title: Linux port when?
body: I think it's already time for a native Linux client... if it's already in Mac and soon in consoles and mobiles why not Ubuntu?{{item:3194}}

replies.body: Riot sucks at software security and are more terrified than sony of users running unix based os's.

> [{quoted}](name=G0blinSlay3r,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=MjGqdygr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-02-18T03:50:40.180+0000)
>
> Riot sucks at software security and are more terrified than sony of users running unix based os's.

That makes zero sense... most software dev shops code on *nix (at least every developer I know prefers it, or at least Mac, for some of them). It has nothing to do with security, it has everything to do with using effort more efficiently. Porting a game to *nix is a significant undertaking and then management of that code adds to the maintenance burden. People complain about how long it takes to fix bugs now, imagine if they needed to fix them for three platforms, instead of one.
And yet they ported it to MacOs a Unix based OS
